title: 114_s3245
content: The Act may be cited as the "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" and supports clinical nurse specialists. The Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016 supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include clinical nurse leader programs eligible for support. The Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016 supports clinical nurse specialists by including education programs that provide full-time clinical nurse specialist education, aiming to educate specialists capable of providing care to inpatients and outpatients with acute and chronic illness. Additionally, the Act defines a nurse-managed health clinic under Section 801 of the Public Health Service Act. The Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016 defines a nurse-managed health clinic as a nurse-practice arrangement managed by advanced practice nurses providing primary care or wellness services to underserved populations. The Act also amends the Public Health Service Act to include nurse-managed health clinics. The Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016 defines a nurse-managed health clinic as a nurse-practice arrangement managed by advanced practice nurses providing primary care or wellness services to underserved populations. It also includes clinical nurse specialists in addition to nurse anesthetists. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs. Title VIII of the Public Health Service Act is amended to update various sections related to loan repayment, scholarship programs, nurse faculty loans, and comprehensive geriatric education by changing the years from 2007 and 2014 to 2021. Funding for carrying out parts B, C, and section 831 is also addressed in section 871. Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to update nurse education, practice, quality, and retention grants by promoting career advancement. The amendment to Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act aims to promote career advancement for nursing personnel through various training opportunities and pathways to become professional nurses, advanced education nurses, licensed practical nurses, certified nurse assistants, and home health aides. The amendment aims to promote career advancement for nursing personnel by developing internships and residency programs to transition from practical nurses, licensed vocational nurses, certified nurse assistants, and home health aides to baccalaureate prepared registered nurses or advanced education nurses. The amendment promotes career advancement for nursing personnel through internships and residency programs in collaboration with accredited nursing schools to develop specialties. Subsection (g) is amended to include nurse-managed health clinics, and subsection (h) is removed.
